title: Historical Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio Trends of Ulta Beauty Inc

content.text: The price-to-book (P/B) ratio is a financial metric used to evaluate the market value of a company relative to its book value. It compares the stock's market price per share to its book value per share. The P/B ratio is a measure of investor sentiment and indicates whether a stock is overvalued or undervalued.
Here is a table of the historical P/B ratio trends for Ulta Beauty Inc stock:

Analyzing the historical P/B ratio trends of Ulta Beauty Inc stock can help investors make informed decisions. If the P/B ratio is increasing over time, it suggests that investors have a positive outlook on the company's future prospects and are willing to pay a higher premium for its book value. Conversely, a decreasing P/B ratio may indicate a negative sentiment and potential undervaluation of the stock. Investors should consider other factors such as industry trends, earnings growth, and competitive landscape to gain a comprehensive understanding of the stock's investment potential.

news.headline: Ulta ‘Shines’ as Beauty Remains Resilient. What Wall Street Thinks About Earnings.
news.summary: Ulta Beauty  stock surged Friday after it received several price target increases from Wall Street based on a strong third-quarter showing.  Shares of the cosmetics retailer jumped 12% to $275.89 and were on pace for their largest percentage increase since May 2022, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  TD Cowen analyst Oliver Chen wrote in a research note Friday that the “top holiday pick shines as beauty is resilient.”

news.headline: Ulta (ULTA) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
news.summary: Shares of beauty, cosmetics, and personal care retailer Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) jumped 9.8% in the morning session after the company reported third quarter results with same-store sales beating convincingly, although revenue only narrowly topped expectations. Profitability was sound, leading to a nice EPS beat in the quarter. The company raised its full year outlook for important metrics such as same-store sales, revenue, and EPS. Finally, management commentary in the release was optimistic, c

news.headline: Ulta stock surges on Q3 earnings, beating sales estimates
news.summary: Ulta Beauty (ULTA) stock roars to life Friday morning after beating third-quarter sales estimates. Piper Sandler Vice President and Senior Research Analyst Korinne Wolfmeyer raised her price target for Ulta to $572 on the earnings performance. Wolfmeyer sits down with Yahoo Finance to talk about Ulta's earnings beat and the beauty brand's retail position as more consumers seek promotional deals in the final month of the year. "Right now we are starting to see some signs of the consumer softening in beauty, very minor but we are seeing... some more price sensitivity," Wolfmeyer says. "Consumers are taking advantage more of promotions. If that intensifies through the holiday, we could see some downside especially if Ulta really does have to hold much more on promotions." For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

news.headline: Ulta Beauty (ULTA) Q3 2023 Earnings Call Transcript
news.summary: Good afternoon, and welcome to Ulta Beauty's conference call to discuss results for the third quarter of fiscal 2023.  Good afternoon, everyone, and thank you for joining us for a discussion of Ulta Beauty's results for the third quarter of fiscal 2023.  Hosting our call today are Dave Kimbell, chief executive officer; and Scott Settersten, chief financial officer.

news.headline: Here's What Key Metrics Tell Us About Ulta (ULTA) Q3 Earnings
news.summary: The headline numbers for Ulta (ULTA) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended October 2023, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

news.headline: Big Day on the Dow, +520 Points; ULTA Beats & Raises
news.summary: The Dow cleaned up this session: +520 points, +1.47%, led by Salesforce (CRM) coming off its impressive Q3 earnings report yesterday.

news.headline: Ulta Beauty raises annual forecasts, longtime CFO Settersten to retire
news.summary: Settersten who has been with the company for nearly 20 years will be succeeded by Paula Oyibo, the company's senior vice president of finance who joined in 2019.  Ulta has also seen a boost from consumer interest steering toward dermatologist recommended brands like La Roche-Posay and CeraVe while also seeing robust demand from social media promotions of brands like Good Molecules, Hero Cosmetics and Peach Slices.  The third quarter saw a slew of new launches notably – 'Half Magic', a vegan and cruelty-free makeup line by Euphoria makeup artist Donni Davy exclusive to Ulta Beauty, hair styling tools from Shark Beauty, dermatologist recommended PanOxyl, a popular Gen Z brand and Sniff, an emerging unisex fragrance.

news.headline: Ulta Beauty Inc (ULTA) Posts Solid Q3 Results with Net Sales Increase
news.summary: Comparable Sales Rise 4.5% and Net Income Reaches $249.5 Million

news.headline: Ulta Beauty Stock Jumps on Another Strong Quarter
news.summary: Ulta Beauty  on Thursday posted another beat-and-raise quarter and announced its long-term chief financial officer was retiring, sending the stock higher in after-hours trading.  The cosmetics retailer reported adjusted earnings of $5.07 a share on $2.49 billion in revenue for its fiscal third quarter.  Ulta also updated its outlook for fiscal 2023, raising the lower end of its guidance range for sales and earnings per share.

news.headline: Ulta stock pops on Q3 earnings beat
news.summary: Ulta Beauty (ULTA) reported third-quarter results that were slightly better than Wall Street expected. The beauty retailer reported adjusted earnings of $5.07 per share, better than the $5.00 analysts had expected. Revenue of $2.5 billion was in line with estimates of $2.47 billion. The company also announced CFO Scott Settersten was retiring and that the company's Senior Vice President of Finance Paula Oyibo will replace him. Yahoo Finance Live breaks down the report. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

news.headline: Ulta Beauty Taps Paula Oyibo as Next Finance Chief
news.summary: CFO JOURNAL   Ulta Beauty tapped Paula Oyibo to succeed Scott Settersten as chief financial officer. The beauty retailer said Settersten informed the company of his decision to retire as financial chief, treasurer and assistant secretary after nearly 20 years with the company.

news.headline: Ulta (NASDAQ:ULTA) Reports Q3 In Line With Expectations but Raises Full Year Outlook, Stock Soars
news.summary: Beauty, cosmetics, and personal care retailer Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) reported results in line with analysts' expectations in Q3 FY2023, with revenue up 6.4% year on year to $2.49 billion. On the other hand, the company's full-year revenue guidance of $11.13 billion at the midpoint came in slightly below analysts' estimates. It made a GAAP profit of $5.07 per share, down from its profit of $5.34 per share in the same quarter last year.
